intro: Silene integripetala subsp. greuteri, commonly known as the Greuter's bladder campion, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showing adaptations to harsh conditions. It has hairy stems and leaves that help reduce water loss. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological and genetic traits compared to other Silene species.
